intro: Lepidagathis rumphii, commonly known as the Java spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in small cyathia. Lepidagathis rumphii is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
